If infinite regress is impossible then how are infinite universes a possibility? Okay, you start with a postulate that infinite regress is impossible.Next, you demonstrate that you considered the concept of infinite universes.We observe that within the system of YOU in your lifetime, that you didn’t exist forever, so you don’t rely on infinite regression as an independent system. If infinite regress is impossible then how are infinite universes a possibility? Infinite regression is possible in the realms of logic and mathematics, whether it is possible in the real world is a different thing and to my best knowledge still an unanswered question. If infinite regression is impossible in the real world then an infinite regression of universes is impossible.If infinite regression is possible in the real world then an infinite regression of universes is possible.We must even be careful before drawing these two conclusions, because in "the real world" is a tricky thing when talking about multiple universes, we do not know whether our rules about "the real world" apply across universes. We derive all our ideas about "the real world" from what we can observe in our universe. How can we be sure that they extent to other universes?

The question proposes a hypothetical in which infinite regresses are impossible but infinite universes are possible… and suggests that there is a contradiction there. The way to do this without it being a contradiction is to propose that these are different kinds of infinities. I can show you how to do this without special pleading by referring you to Cantor’s hotel (look it up). The hypothetical need only rule out higher order infinities in reality. However - there is nothing holding that infinite regress is impossible. There are just situations where a regression does not work as an explanation for something. If the explanation for how the Earth is held up is that it sits on a turtle … then that begs the question: what holds the turtle up? saying it is turtles all the way down does not solve the problem … but not just because it is an infinite regression. The turtle theory involves an infinity of extra features (the turtles) compared with other models - so it falls to Occam’s Razor. Back to the Universe. An infinite Universe is “possible” in the sense that it can be the best and simplest mathematical model of the Universe that accounts for the known facts of Nature and has predictive utility. We do not know that it is possible in Nature or not… it’s just that the Universe appears to us in such a way that an infinite-flat model is the one with the easiest maths, and why do hard maths if you don’t have to am I right?
